alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 8:39AM CST until January 27 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. For the Fourche Lafave River...including Gravelly, Houston...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River near Houston. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 24.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.3 feet this evening. Additional rainfall is in the expected later this week. Continue to monitor latest forecasts for any updates. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Fourche Lafave River Houston 25.0 24.9 Wed 7 am CST 26.3 23.7 17.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 48 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 845 AM CST.
